page.title: 06The Tower of London
page.content: Over 2 million tourists visit the Tower each year, 1 million during the high season. Changing of the guard takes place at 11.30 each morning, and the closing Ceremony of the Keys at 9.45 each night. The Governor of the Tower lives on Tower Green and there are homes inside the outer walls for some 150 people. About 37 of them are Yeoman Warders who live with their families. The others are mainly maintenance workers though there is a barracks for the Royal Fusiliers. Plans for the future include refilling the moat which is currently grass and gardens, extending the White Tower underground for more exhibition rooms and developing the main entrance on Tower Hill.
